items.title: Slot geeft hoopvolle blessure-update Ekitik√©
items.summary: Arne Slot is hoopvol dat hij in het FA Cup-duel met Barnsley weer de beschikking heeft over spits Hugo Ekitik√©. De Fransman moest twee wedstrijden aan zich voorbij laten gaan vanwege een blessure, maar is nu dicht bij een terugkeer.

items.title: Liverpool's Conor Bradley out for season with knee injury
items.summary: Liverpool defender Conor Bradley is set to miss the rest of the season after suffering a serious knee injury in Thursday's 0-0 draw with Arsenal.

items.title: USMNT's Pepi suffers broken arm scoring for PSV
items.summary: United States striker Ricardo Pepi suffered a broken forearm while in action for PSV Eindhoven on Saturday and and is set to be sidelined for two months, the Dutch club has confirmed..

items.title: Salah scores to set up AFCON reunion with Man√©
items.summary: Mohamed Salah scored his fourth goal of the Africa Cup of Nations as Egypt defeated defending champions Ivory Coast 3-2 in Agadir.

items.title: Buoyant Rosenior lauds 5-star Chelsea start
items.summary: New Chelsea head coach Liam Rosenior promised more to come from his second string after they swept aside Charlton 5-1 at the Valley in his first match in charge.

items.title: VI Live: geen Wijndal in Ajax-selectie, Hatenboer debuteert bij Telstar
items.summary: Welkom in deze VI Live met aandacht voor Telstar - Ajax. Om 14.30 uur is de aftrap van dit Eredivisie-duel. Op deze plek houden we je op de hoogte.

items.title: Slot benadrukt: FA Cup belangrijk toernooi voor Liverpool
items.summary: Liverpool neemt het toernooi om de FA Cup dit seizoen uiterst serieus, benadrukt Arne Slot. Maandagavond wacht League One-club Barnsley in de derde ronde.

items.title: Liverpool's Bradley out for season with knee injury
items.summary: Liverpool defender Conor Bradley is ruled out for the rest of the domestic season after suffering a significant knee injury, involving damage to bone and ligament.

items.title: VI Live: Feyenoord-huurling Slory direct in de basis bij Go Ahead

items.title: Jarige Steur opnieuw vervanger van vertrokken Taylor
items.summary: Interim-coach Fred Grim van Ajax kiest bij de hervatting van de Eredivisie, met een uitwedstrijd tegen Telstar, voor hetzelfde middenveld als in de Eredivisie-wedstrijd voor de winterstop. Dit betekent dat Sean Steur opnieuw op de plek van Kenneth Taylor staat.

items.title: Arne Slot hit with Conor Bradley injury blow as he vows to go strong against Barnsley
items.summary: Bradley to miss rest of season with serious knee injury Slot will not repeat past error in FA Cup third-round tie Arne Slot has promised not to repeat last season‚Äôs FA Cup gamble against Plymouth when Liverpool entertain Barnsley in the third round on Monday. One player he will not be able to select, however, is Conor Bradley after it was confirmed the right-back will have to undergo surgery on the knee injury he sustained in Thursday‚Äôs goalless draw with Arsenal and is likely to rule him out for the rest of the season. Slot changed all 10 outfield players for the fourth-round tie at Home Park and was punished as Plymouth, then bottom of the Championship, produced a huge shock to win 1-0. He compounded his selection risk with an inexperienced bench that included only two senior players; Curtis Jones and Darwin N√∫√±ez. Slot stands by his decision on the basis Liverpool were challenging for four trophies at the time. But with his team out of the Carabao Cup and a distant fourth in the Premier League this season, that pressure no longer applies. Continue reading...

items.title: Liverpool's Bradley to miss rest of season with significant knee injury

items.title: ‚ÄòI‚Äôve never celebrated a goal at 9-0 down in my life‚Äô: inside Exeter‚Äôs dressing room on a day to remember
items.summary: League One club offered behind-the-scenes access for FA Cup tie and manager Gary Caldwell will not let crushing loss at Manchester City define them ‚ÄúThe team to win today, lads‚Äù begins Gary Caldwell. Exeter City are two hours from kicking off against Manchester City in the FA Cup third round, and their manager is addressing his players at a hotel shortly before they travel to the Etihad. ‚ÄúYou know why I said that?‚Äù he continues, his thick Scottish accent filling the room. No one knows. He explains the phrase is borrowed from Roberto Mart√≠nez, under whom Caldwell won the competition with Wigan in 2013. It was used to bring humour and break tension when his team were inevitably written off. Continue reading...

items.title: Salah inspires Egypt with energy recalling golden generation to evoke recent history | Jonathan Wilson
items.summary: Liverpool forward will face his former teammate Sadio Man√© in Afcon semi against Senegal after arguably the Pharaohs‚Äô best performance since 2008 It is a long time since Egypt had a night this good. There have been two World Cup qualifications since their golden age of three successive Cups of Nations came to an end in 2010, and they‚Äôve got to the finals of two Cups of Nations since, but this had a different feel to the knockout phases in 2017 or 2021 (played in 2022). This wasn‚Äôt grinding through, doing just enough (across the knockouts in 2017 and 2021, Egypt won one game without needing extra time or penalties; a grim 1-0 against Morocco in the 2017 quarter-final). It was taking on one of the giants of African football and beating them well. A 3-2 victory over C√¥te d‚ÄôIvoire was probably Egypt‚Äôs best single performance since they beat the same opposition 4-1 in the semi-finals of Ghana 2008. That game in Kumasi was always going to cast its shadow over this quarter-final. Saturday‚Äôs coaches were on opposite sides when Egypt beat C√¥te d‚ÄôIvoire on penalties in the 2006 final in Cairo ‚Äì Hossam Hassan as a 39-year-old squad captain and unused sub and √âmerse Fa√© in the centre of midfield ‚Äì but it was the semi-final two years later this game most resembled. The 4-1 hurt C√¥te d‚ÄôIvoire far more than the final had, the image of a bewildered Kolo Tour√© running away from Amr Zaki as he scored Egypt‚Äôs third a symbol of the Pharaohs‚Äô superiority that night. Within four minutes on Saturday, Odilon Kossounou had got in a similar mess, legs tangled as Omar Marmoush sped by him to put Egypt ahead. Continue reading...

items.title: Why Rosenior sees no need for drastic change at Chelsea
items.summary: Liam Rosenior does not see a need for drastic change at Chelsea - and that was part of the reason he was brought in.
